alert.note: Alert for Kings (Brooklyn); Southern Nassau; Southern Queens (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 12:56PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Queens, Kings and southwestern Nassau Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 1256 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Coney Island, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jamaica, Flatbush, Freeport, Valley Stream, Long Beach, Coney Island, Garden City, Lynbrook, Mineola, Woodmere, Rockaway Beach, Jones Beach, Kennedy Airport, Canarsie and Hempstead. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
